nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -7,14 +7,8 @@ assignees: ''
 
 ---
 
-**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
-A clear and concise description of what the problem is and what version of Spring Cloud you are using. Ex. I'm always frustrated when [...]
+**ATTENTION**
 
-**Describe the solution you'd like**
-A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
+Please file all issues in our new repo (Spring Cloud GCP 2.0+): [https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose.](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose)
 
-**Describe alternatives you've considered**
-A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
-
-**Additional context**
-Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
\ No newline at end of file
+We are not accepting new feature requests for Spring Cloud 1.x.

nodes.bodyText: This could be a little surprising for people to first learn about the new repo from here. We should probably also have a blurb about the new repo on the front-page readme. Can we just say, if this is an issue for version 2.0.0 or higher, please file it here? This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters Suggested change Please start filing all issues in our new repo: [https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose.](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose) If this is an issue for version `2.0.0` or higher, please file it in our new repo: [GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp](https://github.com/GoogleCloudPlatform/spring-cloud-gcp/issues/new/choose).

nodes.bodyText:
Well remember:
a.) not many external folks are filing issues these days (so relatively low impact),
b.) we're only a few weeks away from releasing 2.0,
c.) the Spring Cloud announcement that this is happening is almost 18 months old,
d.) all devs should be cherry-picking fixes to both repos anyway (doesn't matter if the bug is 2.0 or not), and
e.) Issues in the new repo fall under our new SLO.

nodes.bodyText:
Some good points, but in that case, "Please start filing..." sounds a bit weak.
Wouldn't we want to say then, "Please file all issues in the new repo."?

nodes.bodyText: I'm not sure we need to say that. Some people might want minor enhancements, and it might be OK. nodes.bodyText: I'd still opt for language strongly encouraging activity in the new repo over the old. Not only because this repo is going into maintenance, but also because we can't control when it will be released. Feature request X in the new repo can be asked on Monday and in the user's hands by Friday.
